revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=2Wire |model=3800 |revision=HGV-B |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/29/2006 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem,analog phone gateway |fcc_id=PGR2W3800,PGR2W3800HP |ic_id=3439B-3800HGV |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=2Wire |cpu1_model=Perseus |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand=Ikanos |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=32 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla2=2 |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4H511638C-UCCC |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR2413A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Davicom |eth_chip2_model=DM9102DEP |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Infineon |sw_model=ADM6996M |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=VDSL, HomePNA 3.1 (coaxial) |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:1D:5A,00:25:3C,34:EF:44 |oui_eth=00:1D:5A,00:25:3C,34:EF:44 }} "3300-000531-001" and "REV 001" is silkscreened :on the back of the board in the FCC photos.
There is a '''CopperGate''' CG3011QI-10 HomePNA chip on-board. :FCC photos show the device with a ''Perseus'' SoC, but :this may not reflect reality for production models.
*The PGR2W3800 FCC ID (2006) covers the 3800HGV-B. *The PGR2W3800HP (2008) covers both 3600HGV and 3800HGV-B.
Noted units.. *Assembly Number: 4200-001039-009 (PGR2W3800) **00:1D:5A OUI ('''2Wire''') *Assembly Number: 4200-001039-011 (PGR2W3800) **00:25:3C OUI ('''2Wire''') **34:EF:44 OUI ('''2Wire''')
*[http://robertlathanh.com/2011/01/att-u-verse-for-the-curious-consumer-the-residential-gateway-and-wiring-options/ View of the back panel] :This device is/was used for '''AT&T''''s U-verse service. :USB (B) port for slave connection for use of the modem by a PC :Coaxial connection for outbound TV service to U-verse STBs :or usage as the WAN connection
*[http://web.archive.org/web/20140725101446/http://hackingbtbusinesshub.wordpress.com/2011/09/12/the-2wire-family-of-tm32-cpus/ ''The family of TriMedia TM32 CPUs'' - Hacking the 2Wire (on archive.org)] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20140603092442/http://hackingbtbusinesshub.wordpress.com/category/perseus/ ''Discovering 2Wire card edge pinout (for JTAG / I2C)'' - Hacking the 2Wire]
